channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL

item.title: Report E-2023100634
item.description:
Report E-2023100634

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-26T15:12:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-20
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLA experienced a UN1197 Caramel FMF Liquid Conc Flavor release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4-gallons of product released to a 10’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor due to a puncture. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents into (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100619
item.description:
Report E-2023100619

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-26T15:12:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-05
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 5, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the trailer interior and asphalt beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed a neutralizing agent to the impacted area. Once neutralized, EWI personnel collected and containerized the damaged pail into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. Granular absorbents were deployed to the impacted area and worked in with hand tools. All UN2922-impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023100621
item.description:
Report E-2023100621

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-26T15:12:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-25
  • City: JOLIET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XJO experienced a UN2920 BTC 1010 release from (4) 330-gallon plastic totes. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived on-site and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released in a 3’ x 1’ area of the tote lids. The caps on the totes were replaced with new ones. The totes were wiped down and all impacted rags and cleanup debris were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023100615
item.description:
Report E-2023100615

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-26T15:12:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-26
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLA experienced a UN1791 AL 15 release from a 30-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-quarts of product released to a 6' x 4' area of the trailer floor due to a pinhole puncture. Citric acid & absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area to clean and neutralize the product. The damaged drum was placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris was placed into a second 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023090558
item.description:
Report E-2023090558

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: OTTAWA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 09/19/2023, at 1042 hrs. Personnel in the CSXT Ottawa Yard discovered MTZX330221, a residue tank car of Propane, leaking from the protective housing. The car was isolated and NGL Supply Wholesale LLC, NRC, Illinois EMA, Ottawa Fire Department were notified. CHEMTREC Report #2023091900178. (RMS), a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the secondary closure not applied and laying on the pressure plate and the A-end liquid line valve open 1/8th of a turn). The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper (Jamee Spears 501-680-2267). Contractor personnel closed the valve, cleaned the threads of the secondary plug, applied new thread tape and tool tightened it in place. The leak was secured and the car was released for transport. This incident (did not) require a special switching move. No 7.1 is required. Cause Code: 312 NARRI: 5
